tool.name: Retention Time (RT) Flags

param.name: input
param.label: Wide Dataset
param.help: Input dataset in wide format and tab separated. If file is not tab separated see TIP below.

param.name: design
param.label: Design File
param.help: Design file tab separated. Note you need a 'sampleID' column. If not tab separated see TIP below.

param.name: uniqID
param.label: Unique Feature ID
param.help: Name of the column in your Wide Dataset that has unique Feature IDs.

param.name: minutes
param.label: Percentile Cutoff
param.help: Percenctile cutoff in minutes. The default value used is 0.2 minutes.

param.name: CVcutoff
param.label: CVcutoff
param.help: The default CV cutoff will flag 10 percent of the rowIDs with larger CVs. If you want to set a CV cutoff, put the number here.

param.name: pctl
param.label: 90th percentile [Optional]
param.help: Check this box to use a 90th percentile. The default is a 95th percentile (NO). [Optional]

tool.help:
@TIP_AND_WARNING@
**Tool Description**
**NOTE:** The tool is primarily intended for metabolomics data analysis and retention time flagging. The goal of the tool is to identify potential problems with the instrument/data processing and pre-processing.
The tool identifies the abnormalities of the featureâ€™s retention time. The following feature characteristics are investigated with each characteristic having a separate flag column in the output file.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Input**
- Two input datasets are required.
@WIDE@
**NOTE:** The sample IDs must match the sample IDs in the Design File (below). Extra columns will automatically be ignored.
@METADATA@
@UNIQID@
**Percentile Cutoff**
- Percenctile cutoff in minutes. The default value used is 0.2 minutes.
**CVcutoff**
- The default CV cutoff will flag 10 percent of the rowIDs with larger CVs. If you want to set a CV cutoff, put the number here.
**90th percentile [Optional]**
- Check this box to use a 90th percentile. The default is a 95th percentile (NO).
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Output**
The tool outputs two files: a TSV file with flags for each feature, where each flagging method results are saved in a separate column and a PDF file containing a density plot of the coefficients of variation (CV) for the retention time.
